t: Proverbs 10
The Proverbs of Solomon
The*p proverbs of Solomon. A*pn wise son makes a glad father, but*ld a foolish son is a sorrow to his mother.
Treasures*ln gained by wickedness do not profit, but*ld righteousness delivers from death.
The*ln Lord*s does not let the righteous go hungry, but*ld he thwarts the craving of the wicked.
A*ln slack hand causes poverty, but*ld the hand of the diligent makes rich.
He*ln who gathers in summer is a prudent son, but*ld he who sleeps in harvest is a son who brings shame.
Blessings*ln are on the head of the righteous, but*ld the mouth of the wicked conceals violence.
The*ln memory of the righteous is a blessing, but*ld the name of the wicked will rot.
The*ln wise of heart will receive commandments, but*ld a babbling fool will come to ruin.
Whoever*ln walks in integrity walks securely, but*ld he who makes his ways crooked will be found out.
Whoever*ln winks the eye causes trouble, and*ld a babbling fool will come to ruin.
The*ln mouth of the righteous is a fountain of life, but*ld the mouth of the wicked conceals violence.
Hatred*ln stirs up strife, but*ld love covers all offenses.
On*ln the lips of him who has understanding, wisdom is found, but*ld a rod is for the back of him who lacks sense.
The*ln wise lay up knowledge, but*ld the mouth of a fool brings ruin near.
A*ln rich manâ€™s wealth is his strong city; the*ld poverty of the poor is their ruin.
The*ln wage of the righteous leads to life, the*ld gain of the wicked to sin.
Whoever*ln heeds instruction is on the path to life, but*ld he who rejects reproof leads others astray.
The*ln one who conceals hatred has lying lips, and*ld whoever utters slander is a fool.
When*ln words are many, transgression is not lacking, but*ld whoever restrains his lips is prudent.
The*ln tongue of the righteous is choice silver; the*ld heart of the wicked is of little worth.
The*ln lips of the righteous feed many, but*ld fools die for lack of sense.
The*ln blessing of the Lord*s makes rich, and*ld he adds no sorrow with it.
Doing*ln wrong is like a joke to a fool, but*ld wisdom is pleasure to a man of understanding.
What*ln the wicked dreads will come upon him, but*ld the desire of the righteous will be granted.
When*ln the tempest passes, the wicked is no more, but*ld the righteous is established forever.
Like*ln vinegar to the teeth and smoke to the eyes, so*ld is the sluggard to those who send him.
The*ln fear of the Lord*s prolongs life, but*ld the years of the wicked will be short.
The*ln hope of the righteous brings joy, but*ld the expectation of the wicked will perish.
The*ln way of the Lord*s is a stronghold to the blameless, but*ld destruction to evildoers.
The*ln righteous will never be removed, but*ld the wicked will not dwell in the land.
The*ln mouth of the righteous brings forth wisdom, but*ld the perverse tongue will be cut off.
The*ln lips of the righteous know what is acceptable, but*ld the mouth of the wicked, what is perverse.
